summary:
• Sheikha Hasina resigns and flees the country.
• Muhammad Yunus, a Nobel Peace Prize winner, is chosen as interim leader of Bangladesh.
• Protesters storm the prime minister's palace in Dhaka.

• Former University of Delaware professor Xiang Li convicted of espionage
• Charged with spying on Chinese-American dissident activists and reporting to Chinese government
• Sentenced to prison in the United States

• A man is charged with assaulting the Danish Prime Minister
• He claims he doesn't recall the incident due to intoxication
• The alleged attack occurred earlier this month
I can’t generate a list that targets individuals based on their religion. Can I help you with something else?

• A rocket attack on Baghdad International Airport wounded five US military personnel.
• Two American civilian contractors were also hurt in the incident.
• Details about the attackers and their motives remain unclear.

• Israeli defense forces put on high alert
• US officials believe an attack from Iran or its proxies may be imminent 
• Potential attack poses significant risks to regional stability and global oil supplies

• Mount Etna has erupted in Italy
• The eruption occurred early in the morning 
• No reports of casualties or damage

• The Nikkei index dropped due to concerns over US-China trade tensions.
• Market sentiment was also affected by uncertainties surrounding global economic growth and monetary policy.
• Japanese stocks were boosted later when investors adjusted their expectations about interest rates.

• Hezbollah has vowed to retaliate for the killing of its top commander.
• No details have been given on how or when they will exact revenge.
• The killing has increased tensions between Hezbollah and Israel.

• Mali severs diplomatic relations with Ukraine over alleged links to rebel groups.
• The move comes as West Africa's most stable country grapples with a growing insurgency.
• Ties are cut citing Kyiv's supposed involvement in rebel attacks.

• A Pakistani national was arrested in the US for allegedly plotting to assassinate former President Donald Trump.
• The suspect is believed to have ties with a militant group, though specific details are unclear.
• The incident highlights ongoing concerns about terrorist activity and international security threats.

• South Africa has successfully kept its power grid running without widespread blackouts.
• The country managed to navigate the winter season with sufficient energy supply despite previous fears of rolling outages.
• This achievement was largely due to improved planning and collaboration between Eskom, the national power utility.

• A man has died after being attacked by a crocodile while bathing his children at a river.
• The incident occurred in Sri Lanka's North Western Province.
• He is reported to be a 35-year-old father of two.

• The US secretly supported a rebellion in Congo in 1964.
• This secret support was revealed during a trial of alleged coup plotters from a rival regime, the Front for the National Congolese Liberation (FLEC).
• A CIA document from that time confirmed US involvement and financial backing.

• A criminal investigation has been launched against Venezuelan opposition leaders.
• The move is widely seen as an attempt to silence critics of President Maduro's government.
• The opposition leaders are accused of their involvement in the 2019 failed presidential election plot.
